description: This course introduces students to intensive research at St. Olaf and the Boulder Laboratory for
3-D Electron Microscopy of Cells at the University of Colorado. In Boulder, students prepare
samples for electron microscopy and immuno-gold Electron Microscopy, capture EM-images,
and generate 3-D Tomograms. At St. Olaf students generate 3-D computer models of their
datasets. Prerequisite: Biology 125. Offered in alternate years during Interim.
